docs.lead_paragraph: Older patients without anyone to make medical decisions on their behalf are described as unbefriended. In a crisis, there is no one to speak for them.

headline.main: Near the End, It’s Best to Be ‘Friended’
headline.print_headline: The Last ‘Friend’ You May Ever Need

docs.abstract: Significant percentage of elderly patients who are seriously ill and unable to make medical decisions for themselves have no close friends or family members to make decisions for them; hospitals, public agencies and legislators are trying to come up with new guidelines to help medical staff dilemma presented by 'unbefriended' patients.
docs.snippet: Older patients without anyone to make medical decisions on their behalf are described as unbefriended. In a crisis, there is no one to speak for them.

keywords.value: Living Wills and Health Care Proxies
keywords.name: subject
